text: Louis Clark (27 February 1947 – 13 February 2021) was an English music arranger and keyboard player. In 1977, Clark arranged the music of Renaissance for their Albert Hall concert with the RPO. In the early 1980s, he conducted the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra on a series of records under the title Hooked on Classics. Clark died on 13 February 2021 in Elyria, Ohio from kidney disease, aged 73.Louis Clark, Who Orchestrated ELO and Later ‘Hooked on Classics,’ Dies ==References== Category:1947 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from renal failure Category:British keyboardists Category:Musicians from Bedfordshire
title: Louis Clark
